author: sandriaas
body:
<!--

For Windows PowerShell 5.1 issues, suggestions, or feature requests please use the following link instead:
Windows PowerShell [UserVoice](https://windowsserver.uservoice.com/forums/301869-powershell)

This repository is **ONLY** for PowerShell Core 6 issues.

- Make sure you are able to repro it on the [latest released version](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases)
- Search the existing issues.
- Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- Refer to the [known issues](https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/whats-new/known-issues-ps6?view=powershell-6).

-->

# Steps to reproduce

```
1. creating new module based on this script inside PSModulePath folder using name "EnvPath"
https://gallery.technet.microsoft.com/scriptcenter/3aa9d51a-44af-4d2a-aa44-6ea541a9f721#content

2. "Import-Module EnvPath"


```

# Expected behavior

```
the module should be detected without error and gets imported just fine

PS C:\WINDOWS\system32> Import-Module EnvPath
PS C:\WINDOWS\system32> Get-Command -Module EnvPath

CommandType     Name                                               Version    Source
-----------     ----                                               -------    ------
Function        ADD-PATH                                           0.0        EnvPath
Function        GET-PATH                                           0.0        EnvPath
Function        REMOVE-PATH                                        0.0        EnvPath
Function        SET-PATH                                           0.0        EnvPath
Function        TEST-LocalAdmin                                    0.0        EnvPath
```

# Actual behavior

```
it detects missing closing "}" on the module and the import fail

PS C:\Windows> Import-Module EnvPath
At C:\WINDOWS\system32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\Modules\EnvPath\EnvPath.psm1:38 char:1
+ {
+ ~
Missing closing '}' in statement block or type definition.
+ CategoryInfo          : ParserError: (:) [], ParentContainsErrorRecordException
+ FullyQualifiedErrorId : MissingEndCurlyBrace

Import-Module : The specified module 'EnvPath' was not loaded because no valid module file was found in any module directory.
At line:1 char:1
+ Import-Module EnvPath
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
+ CategoryInfo          : ResourceUnavailable: (EnvPath:String) [Import-Module], FileNotFoundException
+ FullyQualifiedErrorId : Modules_ModuleNotFound,Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.ImportModuleCommand

```

# Environment data

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.0.0-preview.1
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.0.0-preview.1
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.18932
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```

comments.author: bpayette
comments.body: Hi @andrizmitnick - I tried this (downloading, installing and importing the module) and everything seemed to work fine. Could your file have somehow gotten corrupted? If you rename it to a `.ps1` file, can you run it?

comments.author: sandriaas
comments.body:
Hello, yesterday i just updated my windows. now i just tried it again and somehow it works 😂
seems like to be my own issue, sorry for your time and thank you!!

comments.author: sandriaas
comments.body: the issues seems to be specific on my system, and recent windows update seems to fix it. it's working fine now.

title: Import-Module incorrectly detect error and fail
